name: Corrupted Ushabti
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The corrupted ushabti makes two Ceremonial Greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Ceremonial Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Vomit Swarm (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The corrupted ushabti exhales scarabs in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 25 (10d4) piercing damage and is covered in scarabs. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't covered in scarabs. A creature covered in scarabs takes 2 (1d4) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature, including the covered creature, can take its action to brush the scarabs off the covered creature by succeeding on a DC 15 Dexterity check.

special_abilities.name: Necrotic Weapons
special_abilities.desc: The ushabti's weapon attacks are magical. When the ushabti hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

special_abilities.name: Regeneration
special_abilities.desc: The ushabti regains 5 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp.

special_abilities.name: Swarm Body
special_abilities.desc: The corrupted ushabti is a spirit inhabiting a colony of scarabs around a Humanoid skeleton within funerary wrappings. It can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny scarab and Humanoid bones, and it can't regain hp or gain temporary hp, except for its Regeneration trait.

special_abilities.name: Undead Nature
special_abilities.desc: The ushabti doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
